instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01814: What is 820-01814? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.USBC_XA_CC2: What is USBC_XA_CC2? USBC_XA_CC2 is a line between the USB-C muxing chip such as the CD3217 or CD3215 and the USB-C charger. Communication must happen on this line in order for the USB-C charger to put out 20v..
definitions.USBC_XB_CC1: What is USBC_XB_CC1? USBC_XB_CC1 is a line between the USB-C muxing chip such as the CD3217 or CD3215 and the USB-C charger. Communication must happen on this line in order for the USB-C charger to put out 20v..
definitions.USBC_XB_CC2: What is USBC_XB_CC2? USBC_XB_CC2 is a line between the USB-C muxing chip such as the CD3217 or CD3215 and the USB-C charger. Communication must happen on this line in order for the USB-C charger to put out 20v..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 dead amp meter flashing light
threads.message:
The board came in dead, ammeter flashes light every 2sec,no display on ammeter.
No shot on <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 dead amp meter flashing light
threads.message:
All the ports have the same behavior?
Check diode mode to ground on the CC1/2 lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 dead amp meter flashing light
threads.message:
Yes all the ports has the same behavior 
<SIGNAL>USBC_XB_CC1</SIGNAL>=0.984
<SIGNAL>USBC_XB_CC2</SIGNAL>=0.981
<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_CC1</SIGNAL>=0.986
<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_CC2</SIGNAL>=0.980

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 dead amp meter flashing light
threads.message:
Check and compare values between all 4 ports.
Also check diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> and all big coils.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 dead amp meter flashing light
threads.message:
I found a short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on precisely on  <CHIP>U9080</CHIP>.hmmm
I guess the nand flash is fried 
Any solution. Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 dead amp meter flashing light
threads.message:
If the short comes from a NAND chip, change all NANDs maintaining correct order.
You can get them from donor board, or Aliexpress (marked chips in kit).
